indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
1.1: Number of completed feasibility plans prepared for BRT in Punjab 1.2: Number of studies awarded and completed. 1.3: Extent to which effective capacity building programmes for UU developed and implemented [Scale = 1. No capacity building program; 2. capacity building program developed, but not being implemented ; 3. capacity building program developed, and partially implemented; 4. capacity building program well-established, and fully implemented] 1.4: Number of approved integrated BRT implementation plans for selected cities in Punjab Province 1.5: Extent to which a demonstration BRT system is developed. [Scale = 1. Not developed ; 2. Partially developed ; 3. Fully developed] 1.6: Cumulative GHG reductions from the BRT demos in a city of Punjab-ktonnes CO2 1.7:Cumulative energy savings enhanced by BRT pilot demonstration 1.8: % increase in public transit ridership 1.9: Extent to which Methodology and M&E plan for the measurement of the specific energy and emission parameters exist [Scale = 1. Methodology and m&e plan not exist; 2. Methodology exist but not m&e plan ; 3. Methodology exist as well as m&e plan] 1.10: Extent to which institutional frameworks developed and are being able to effectively facilitate holistic urban transport planning in Punjab [Scale: 1. No framework in place; 2. Framework in place but weak facilitation to urban transport planning; 3. Framework in place and partially effective in facilitating urban transport planning; 4. There is evidence that the Framework is being actively used as one tool by urban transport planning in Punjab] 1.11: Number of strategic integrated urban transport plans 1.12: Provincial policies for integrated Sustainable Urban Transport exist [Scale: 1. Policy do not exist; 2. Policy in the process of development; 3. Policy fully implemented and enforced]
2.1: Number of completed feasibility plans prepared for BRT in Sindh for existing/new corridors 2.2: Number of public private financing secured based on th

DESCRIPTION The provision of technical assistance to the Government of Punjab and Government of Sindh in development, implementation and demonstration of Bus Rapid Transit (BRT) are also underway. This technical assistance would mainly comprise of feasibility studies for passenger load, ticketing systems, feeder routes, sustainability of government subsidies and other structure related aspects for the cities where the BRT is already in place. UNDP is helping the Government of Sindh in identifying BRT corridors, conducting socio-economic and environment surveys and several other aspects of Bus-Rapid Transit systems. These studies are being carried out in coordination with Asian Development Bank and on the request of the relevant government agencies. UNDP is also helping in raising awareness about the sustainable transport concepts among the masses and also among the government stakeholders and policy makers. The knowledge exchange programmes were also organized by the project to witness and learn from the successful implementation of BRT systems of developed countries. These exchange visits are helpful in learning from the experiences from

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
1.1: Extent to which increase support for sustainable NTFP production/use within private sector in Pakistan through BBRT [Scale = 1. Not at All; 2. Partially; 3. Largely; 4. Fully] 1.2: Number of voluntary NTFP certification systems established 1.3: Number of alliances with national & international buyers representing preferential markets for certified biodiversity-friendly NTFP from project CBEs 1.4: Revised regulatory framework for NTFP collection, processing & trade. [Scale = 1. Not at All; 2. To a very partial extent; 3. To some extent; 4. To a significant extent; 5. To full extent]
2.1: Extent to which conservancy villages & valleys receiving support for CBE development & management [Scale = 1. Not adequate; 2. Partially; 3. Moderately; 4. Mostly/Fully] 2.2: Number of operational CBEs with approved business plans participating in voluntary NTFP certification schemes 2.3: Extent to which Community access to relevant technical, financial and market information services for CBE development have been effective [Scale = 1. Not at All; 2. To a very partial extent; 3. To some extent; 4. To a significant extent; 5. To full extent]
3.1: Number of specific biodiversity conservation measures successfully implemented by project CBEs at landscape level under their Conservation and SRU Agreements. 3.2: Number of collaborative forest management initiatives developed and implemented by State Forestry departments and local communities. 3.3: Extent to which the developed monitoring system for community-based adaptive management of CBEs effectively enhance community ownership and ensure transparency. [Scale = 1. Not at All; 2. To a very partial extent; 3. To some extent; 4. To a significant extent; 5. To full extent]
4.1: Extent to which the capacity development of key institutions has been effective in providing technical and business support services to CBEs. [Scale = 1. Very Partially; 2. Partially; 3. Fully] 4.2: Extent to which project knowledge and lesson learnt have b

1.1: 1 [Not at All} 1.2: 0 1.3: 0 1.4: 1 [Not at All]
2.1: 1 [Not adequate] 2.2: 0 2.3: 1 [Not at All]
3.1: 0 3.2: 0 3.3: 2 [To a very partial extent]
4.1: 1 [Very Partially] 4.2: 1 [Not used]

target.comment:
1.1: 2 [Partially] 1.2: 1 1.3: 0 1.4: 3 [To some extent]
2.1: 2 [Partially] 2.2: 10 2.3: 3 [To some extent]
3.1: 1 3.2: 1 3.3: 3 [To some extent]
4.1: 2 [Partially] 4.2: 3 [Moderately used]

actual.comment:
1.1: 2 [Partially] 1.2: 1 1.3: 0 1.4: 3 [To some extent]
2.1: 2 [Partially] 2.2: 10 2.3: 3 [To some extent]
3.1: 1 3.2: 1 3.3: 3 [To some extent]
4.1: 2 [Partially] 4.2: 3 [Moderately used]
DESCRIPTION: Project formally coordinated and launched; hiring of staff for KPK and remainder staff for GB completed. Several activities including establishment of BBRT, initiation process for certification schemes, development of product sheets on NTFP’s, developing draft rules for medicinal and aromatic plants extraction in GB, provincial consultations on various components held. Need assessment training and capacity building exercises for around 20 departmental nominees carried out; CBE’s established, registered and provided with financial support as incubator funds. Conservancy institutions were linked Mountain Areas Conservancy Funds for financial assistance. Detailed baseline for select key NTFP species has been established in the field and areas for collaborative forest management, selected. Several meetings, orientation workshops with the stakeholders conducted. Project website launched and updated.

target.comment:
1.1: 3 [Largely] 1.2: 2 1.3: 4 1.4: 4 [To a significant extent]
2.1: 4 [Mostly/Fully] 2.2: 20 2.3: 4 [To a significant extent]
3.1: 2 3.2: 1 3.3: 4 [To a significant extent]
4.1: 3 [Fully] 4.2: 4 [Extensively used]

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
1.1: Extent to which ECP internal institutional management is enhanced [Scale = 1. Not adequately; 2. Very partially; 3. Partially; 4. Largely; 5. Fully] 1.2: Extent to which the ECP delivers improved electoral administration. [Scale = 1. Not adequately; 2. Very partially; 3. Partially; 4. Largely; 5. Fully] 1.3: Extent to which ECPs engages constructively with stakeholders [Scale = 1. Not adequately; 2. Very partially; 3. Partially; 4. Largely; 5. Fully]
2.1: Extent to which stakeholders engaged in constructive and inclusive dialogue on electoral reforms [Scale: 1 = Not at all (0%); 2 = to a very partial extent (up to 20%); 3=to some extent (21-50%); 4= to a significant extent (51-85%); 5=to full extent (100%)] 2.2: Extent to which electoral framework reflects international norms and good practice [Scale: 1 = Not at all (0%); 2 = to a very partial extent (up to 20%); 3=to some extent (21-50%); 4= to a significant extent (51-85%); 5=to full extent (100%)]
3.1: Extent to which civic literacy among citizens, especially youth, women and minorities is enhanced [Scale = 1. Not adequately (upto 25%); 2. Very partially (26%-50%); 3. Partially (51%-75%); 4. Largely (75% and above)]

baseline.comment:
1.1: 1 [Not adequately] 1.2: 1 [Not adequately] 1.3: 1 [Not adequately]
2.1: 2 [to a very partial extent (up to 20%)] 2.2: 2 [to a very partial extent (up to 20%)]
3.1: 1 [Not adequately (upto 25%)]

target.comment:
1.1: 2 [Very partially] 1.2: 2 [Very partially] 1.3: 2 [Very partially]
2.1: 3 [to some extent (21-50%)] 2.2: 3 [to some extent (21-50%)]
3.1: 2 [Very partially (26%-50%)]

actual.comment:
1.1: 2 [Very partially] 1.2: 2 [Very partially] 1.3: 2 [Very partially]
2.1: 3 [to some extent (21-50%)] 2.2: 2 [to a very partial extent (up to 20%)]
3.1: 2 [Very partially (26%-50%)]
DESCRIPTION: 1. The target was not fully achieved due to the suspension of programing activities following the PTI protests (August to October). As a consequence 15 trainings were held (OTT and BRIDGE). 2. A series of 8 OTT trainings were conducted. A total of 184 ECP officials – DECs and EOs were trained on Office Technology Training (OTT) in the four provinces of Pakistan. 3. 7 BRIDGE trainings were conducted. 199 District Election Officers (DECs) including facilitators were trained on BRIDGE training from the four provinces of Pakistan (Men:195, women:4). 4. On electoral reform workshops the project exceeded its target. A total of 36 seminars were held. 287 people participated in the electoral reforms from all the four provinces of Pakistan (Men:94, women:78, youth:89) 5. 189 People participated in the seminars on civic and voter education including civil society organizations, media and youth (Men:111, women:78). 6. Micro Capital Grant was awarded to 4 CSOs, one in each province for a pilot project on civic education with local communities. A total of 62 master trainers of the CSOs were trained through interactive training techniques (Men:35, women:27). 7. 25 UNVs selected to promote civic and voter education in schools and communities (Men:18, women:7). 8. 450 street theaters conducted in 32 districts of Pakistan covered the 50014 direct audience (Men: 19829, women: 10086, youth: 20099).

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
1.1: Extent to which designed mechanisms are effectively operationalised in order to mainstream DRR. [Scale: 1 = Not at all (0%); 2 = to a very partial extent (upto 20%); 3=to some extent (21-50%); 4= to a significant extent (51-85%); 5=to full extent (100%)] 1.2: Number of persons (men and women) from public and private sector hat are given on-the-job training on DRR/ GIS/ IM 1.3: Number of assessments and researches conducted related to DRR and climate change impact 1.4: Extent to which sub-national and district level DMAs strengthened to operate effectively [Scale: 1 = Not at all (0%); 2 = to a very partial extent (upto 20%); 3=to some extent (21-50%); 4= to a significant extent (51-85%); 5=to full extent (100%)]
2.1: Number of CO formed in selected villages to implement CBDRM interventions 2.2: Extent to which Community organizations have been effective in preparing communities to respond to disasters [Scale: 1 = Not at all (0%); 2 = to a very partial extent (upto 20%); 3=to some extent (21-50%); 4= to a significant extent (51-85%); 5=to full extent (100%)] 2.3: Extent to which local communities are disaster risk resilient [Scale: 1 = Not at all (0%); 2 = to a very partial extent (upto 20%); 3=to some extent (21-50%); 4= to a significant extent (51-85%); 5=to full extent (100%)] 2.4 Number of risk reduction measure implemented at local level
3.1 Number communities sensitised on safer construction measures

baseline.comment:
1.1: 1 [Not at all] 1.2: 0 1.3: 0 1.4: 1 [Not at all]
2.1: 0 2.2: 2 [to a very partial extent] 2.3: 2 [to a very partial extent] 2.4: 0
3.1: 0

target.comment:
1.1: 2 [to a very partial extent] 1.2: 150 1.3: 1 1.4: 2 [to a very partial extent]
2.1: 15 2.2: 3 [to some extent] 2.3: 3 [to some extent] 2.4: 15
3.1: 15

actual.comment:
1.1: 2 [to a very partial extent] 1.2: 100 1.3: 1 1.4: 2 [to a very partial extent]
2.1: 12 2.2: 3 [to some extent] 2.3: 3 [to some extent] 2.4: 10
3.1:10
DESCRIPTION: In 2014, UNDP continued its work with the national and subnational authorities and selected communities with the aim to enhance community resilience through community based disaster risks management.
With UNDP support, NDMP Implementation Unit has been established which is enabling the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) to build its capacity to monitor progress on government’s 10-year National Disaster Management Plan (NDMP).
The National Institute for Disaster Management (NIDM) was also supported to sustain its activities and extend its outreach to the provinces. It is now successfully catering to the training needs of the provincial and district government departments in DRR/DRM.
The communities prone to floods are now able to take precautionary measures in advance. This is due to improved capacity of the Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) for dissemination of early warning messages through SMS and radio. With the technical and financial support of UNDP, the PMD developed and field-tested dissemination of flood early warning messages and disseminated more than six million flood alerts during the monsoon period.
The floods, in 2014, once again hit a major part of the country in Kashmir and Punjab Province. UNDP supported the government in carrying out flood damage assessment and formulation of early recovery framework.

target.comment:
1.1: 3 [to some extent] 1.2: 300 1.3: 2 1.4: 3 [to some extent]
2.1: 30 2.2: 4 [to a significant extent] 2.3: 4 [to a significant extent] 2.4: 30
3.1: 30
